content:
• Wednesday, September 5, 2012
  • MIND

    More on Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q2 beats on all counts as total revenue jumps 8.4%...

    More on Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q2 beats on all counts as total revenue jumps 8.4% Y/Y. Profit surged, driven by a favorable tax impact which masked a decline in equipment leasing revenue. The company issued upbeat comments for H2 however, saying it expects leasing business results to improve, with activity already picking up in Latin America. It also expects strong winter seasons in Canada and Russia, as well as solid marine leasing activity. Shares +5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 PM
  • TLRD

    More on Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q2 beats on its bottom line, as net earnings rose 4.1% on better...

    More on Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q2 beats on its bottom line, as net earnings rose 4.1% on better same-store sales growth and stronger margins. The company also ups its FY12 guidance, now seeing earnings of $2.74 to $2.80 a share and revenue growth of 4.8% to 5.6%. For the current quarter, it sees sales growth coming in around 8.8% to 9.3%. Street estimates project revenue growth of 6%. Shares +8.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $29.7M (-4.8% Y/Y)...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $29.7M (-4.8% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 PM
  • WCRX

    Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) -10.1% AH after announcing a secondary offering of its ordinary...

    Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) -10.1% AH after announcing a secondary offering of its ordinary shares by selling shareholders including funds affiliated with Bain Capital, J.P. Morgan Partners and Thomas H. Lee Partners. WCRX will not receive any proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • TLRD

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q2 EPS of $1.15 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $662M (+1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q2 EPS of $1.15 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $662M (+1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) has resumed trading following its FQ2 warning. Shares are down 17.7%...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) has resumed trading following its FQ2 warning. Shares are down 17.7% AH to $4.41, putting them within striking distance of their 52-week low of $4.14. Rival STEC could also move in trading tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) warns it expects FQ2 (ended Aug. 31) revenue of $110M-$120M, below...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) warns it expects FQ2 (ended Aug. 31) revenue of $110M-$120M, below guidance of $130M-$140M and a consensus of $134.4M. The solid-state drive vendor claims NAND flash memory shortages are "primarily" to blame (ed: Toshiba recently cut output, and Apple is taking up a lot of supply). However, OCZ has also been dealing with weak PC demand and a tough pricing environment. Shares are halted, and will resume trading at 5:20PM ET.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) -2.6% AH after announcing a 3.5M share stock offering - 3.175M newly-issued...

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) -2.6% AH after announcing a 3.5M share stock offering - 3.175M newly-issued shares, and 325K sold by insiders. The offering stands to increase the real estate site's share count by 11%, and would raise $134.6M at current levels. Zillow only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes," which may include acquisitions. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • SEAC

    SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q2 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $36.7M (-4%...

    SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q2 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $36.7M (-4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -14% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • EEP

    Enbridge Energy Partners (NYSE:EEP) -4.1% AH after saying it launched a public offering of 14M...

    Enbridge Energy Partners (NYSE:EEP) -4.1% AH after saying it launched a public offering of 14M common units and expects to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 2.1M units. EEP expects to use the net proceeds to fund a portion of its capital expansion projects and/or for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Struggling Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) says it will shut down 60 underperforming/non-strategic stores -...

    Struggling Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) says it will shut down 60 underperforming/non-strategic stores - 38 regular grocery stores, and 22 Save-A-Lot stores - by the end of this fiscal year (ends Feb. '13). The company expects to record an $80M-$90M pre-tax charge (mostly non-cash) related to the move, and a gain of $10M on asset sales. Cash savings are expected to total $35M within 12 months, and $80M-$90M over the next 3 years. Shares +3.1% AH. (labor issues)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • DLA

    Delta Apparel (NYSEMKT:DLA): FQ4 EPS of $0.55 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $135.4M (-2% Y/Y)...

    Delta Apparel (NYSEMKT:DLA): FQ4 EPS of $0.55 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $135.4M (-2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • SPA

    Sparton (NYSE:SPA): FQ4 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $61.3M (+0.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Sparton (NYSE:SPA): FQ4 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $61.3M (+0.5% Y/Y) misses by $1.2M. Shares +8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAY

    More on VeriFone's FQ3: The payment processor notes forex is hurting results, but gives no...

    More on VeriFone's FQ3: The payment processor notes forex is hurting results, but gives no further explanation for the revenue miss. FQ4 guidance is for revenue of $495M-$500M and EPS of $0.75-$0.77 vs. a consensus of $520.2M and $0.74. Also, Latin American revenue is expected to fall to $65M-$75M from FQ3's $94.4M due to "isolated events," before rebounding to $90M-$95M in FQ1. North American sales +7.2% Q/Q, but EMEA (41% of total) only +0.5%. PAY -10% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $23.1M (+8.4% Y/Y)...

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $23.1M (+8.4% Y/Y) beats by $1.4M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • VRNT

    Verint Systems (NASDAQ:VRNT): Q2 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $215M beats by $8M....

    Verint Systems (NASDAQ:VRNT): Q2 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $215M beats by $8M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ1 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $58.7M (-5% Y/Y)...

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ1 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $58.7M (-5% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • DDMGQ

    Digital Domain (DDMG -30.5%) crashes below $1 after disclosing it has defaulted on debt payments...

    Digital Domain (DDMG -30.5%) crashes below $1 after disclosing it has defaulted on debt payments for $35M worth of senior notes. The company announced this afternoon that its creditors agreed not to pursue legal action for the time being, but that only gave a slight lift to shares. DDMG adds it continues to evaluate strategic alternatives, including a debt refinancing deal and an offer for a "significant equity investment" in a subsidiary. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM): Q2 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $68.3M (+70% Y/Y) beats...

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM): Q2 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $68.3M (+70% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • HRB

    H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ1 EPS of -$0.38 in-line. Revenue of $96M (-4% Y/Y) misses by $5M....

    H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ1 EPS of -$0.38 in-line. Revenue of $96M (-4% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ3 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $493M (+56% Y/Y) misses by $5M....

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ3 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $493M (+56% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -13.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +6.5%) has registered big gains for the second day in a row (previous); shares are...

    Yelp (YELP +6.5%) has registered big gains for the second day in a row (previous); shares are now up 41% since the reviews site's lockup expiration ended last Wednesday. Today's gains follow an upbeat presentation from CEO Jeremy Stoppelman at a Citi conference (webcast). Stoppelman reiterated the strong performance of ads on Yelp's mobile site, and estimated 25% of unique users come from mobile devices (ed: that's actually lower than some other Web services).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy's (GPOR +7%) second strong well result from the Utica shale and the negligible...

    Gulfport Energy's (GPOR +7%) second strong well result from the Utica shale and the negligible Gulf Coast oil production interruption from Hurricane Isaac bode well for its Q3 earnings outlook, Sidoti says in initiating coverage with a Buy rating and $37 target price. Initial production from the second Utica well lagged the first well, but the oil contribution was much higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -2.9%) CEO Steven Newman expresses confidence the company ultimately will...

    Transocean (RIG -2.9%) CEO Steven Newman expresses confidence the company ultimately will overturn an operating ban upheld by a panel of three Brazilian judges following an oil spill last November; since 10 of RIG's 127 active rigs are in Brazil, a stoppage would impact earnings. He also says RIG continues to engage in discussions over civil and criminal sides of the Macondo spill (earlier).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +2.5%) CFO Ken Hannah reiterates at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +2.5%) CFO Ken Hannah reiterates at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing Conference that the company should end the year with over a $1B in cash. While conceding that the retailer saw slumping traffic as a major challenge this year, the exec keeps the faith that the shops within stores concept will register with consumers. As part of its "shops" transformation, 700 similar-sized JCP stores will receive 100 shops each. Technology remains a major focus in stores, with plans to utilize RFID tagging, iPads, and refresh stations. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • CCRN

    Shares of Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN +14.9%) are soaring today after Citigroup upped it to a...

    Shares of Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN +14.9%) are soaring today after Citigroup upped it to a Buy on valuation with a $7 price target this morning. Citi says if Obamacare gets implemented, the company has the potential to benefit from a strong new growth cycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • PSX

    Phillips 66's (PSX -2%) Alliance Refinery in Belle Chasse, La., lost power this morning, an...

    Phillips 66's (PSX -2%) Alliance Refinery in Belle Chasse, La., lost power this morning, an outage the company says will slow the restarting of the facility following Hurricane Isaac. PSX had said the power was back on at the 247K bbl/day refinery, but that it would take a few weeks for the refinery to return to normal production levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • DIS

    Shares of Disney (DIS +2.5%) trace out a new all-time high with the Street still firmly backing...

    Shares of Disney (DIS +2.5%) trace out a new all-time high with the Street still firmly backing the House of Mouse to see even further gains. Though theme parks, ESPN, and Marvel Studios continue to be the rock stars behind the company's consistent revenue growth - clever deals in new areas also keep the Disney pipeline fresh. The latest is a venture to supply Nokia with edgy content and apps for its smartphones as the Finnish company trails far behind Apple and Google.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 5 Comments
  • MHO

    M/I Homes (MHO -8.4%) slips after announcing a concurrent offering of 2.2M common shares and...

    M/I Homes (MHO -8.4%) slips after announcing a concurrent offering of 2.2M common shares and $50M in convertible senior subordinated notes due 2017. The home builder says it plans to use proceeds for land acquisitions, development, home construction, capital expenditures, increasing its working capital and repayment of indebtedness, among other things. The company has about 18.2 million shares outstanding as of July 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • HITK

    Hi-Tech Pharmacal (HITK -12%) gets slammed after missing on its FQ1 earlier this morning. Net...

    Hi-Tech Pharmacal (HITK -12%) gets slammed after missing on its FQ1 earlier this morning. Net earnings fell 56% as lower average prices for its generic nasal spray contributed to its first revenue decline in two years. The specialty pharmaceutical company's bottom line also was hurt by increased expenses for sales and advertising, as well as R&D at its generic business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • SEE

    Bloomberg says Sealed Air (SEE +4.8%) is poised to turn into a takeover target after a $2.9B...

    Bloomberg says Sealed Air (SEE +4.8%) is poised to turn into a takeover target after a $2.9B acquisition last year wiped out a third of its market value and left it trading at a 64% discount to sales. SEE has a low valuation that, combined with its cash flow and the potential to improve margins, could entice buyers willing to pay as much as $22/share, according to one analyst.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • PDEX

    Pro-Dex (PDEX -4.8%) takes a hit after reporting an FQ4 loss of -$0.14 per share, versus a gain...

    Pro-Dex (PDEX -4.8%) takes a hit after reporting an FQ4 loss of -$0.14 per share, versus a gain of $0.31 per share in the same year-ago period. Sales for the period decreased 46% to $3.7M. The company attributes the decrease in sales and the resulting net losses to a reduction in purchases of it's medical device products by its largest customer.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +5%) bounces on news Mark Zuckerberg won't be selling shares for at least a year....

    Facebook (FB +5%) bounces on news Mark Zuckerberg won't be selling shares for at least a year. Zynga (ZNGA +2.5% - previous) is also trading higher. Earlier, the president of Facebook institutional investor CoRise went on CNBC (video) to talk up the company's e-commerce potential. "If they just got 2 percent of their 500 million people that live on Facebook every single day to buy something through an Amazon store ... Facebook would get $1 billion or so in commissions."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 6 Comments
  • UAL

    Shares of United Continental (UAL +4.8%) bounce higher after the carrier tips off at the Dahlman...

    Shares of United Continental (UAL +4.8%) bounce higher after the carrier tips off at the Dahlman Rose Global Transportation Conference that it will reduce capacity in FY12. The carrier also notes that it has $4B in non-aircraft debt coming due in the next 4 years. (webcast, presentation slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAH

    Cardinal Health (CAH -1.5%) slides after being downgraded to Market Perform at William Blair...

    Cardinal Health (CAH -1.5%) slides after being downgraded to Market Perform at William Blair earlier today. The firm says there's some uncertainty regarding contract renewals with Walgreens, who appears to be considering moving its brand purchasing in-house.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • SM

    SM Energy (SM +5.6%) shares jump on news that net production from the Eagle Ford shale...

    SM Energy (SM +5.6%) shares jump on news that net production from the Eagle Ford shale program averaged 230 MMcfe/day in July, and the company is starting up additional tank batteries to allow for continued production growth. Also, the borrowing base on SM's revolving credit facility is increased by its bank group to $1.55B from $1.4B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • PT-OLD

    Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -2.6%) falls after JPMorgan downgrades shares to Underweight. Like...

    Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -2.6%) falls after JPMorgan downgrades shares to Underweight. Like other peripheral eurozone telcos, weak mobile services demand and huge debt obligations have been weighing on PT.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • BONT

    Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT +19.1%) goes on a run as execs with the company present a turnaround...

    Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT +19.1%) goes on a run as execs with the company present a turnaround plan at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing Conference (webcast). CEO Brendan Hoffman admits the company targeted a younger audience too abruptly and alienated its core shoppers in the process. The new strategy is to focus on coupons and pricing to bring value customers back into the fold. Also: Keybanc upgrades to Buy from Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM -6.2%) is hit hard by downgrades to Underperform and Sell from BNP...

    STMicroelectronics (STM -6.2%) is hit hard by downgrades to Underperform and Sell from BNP Paribas and UBS, respectively. The chipmaker is expected to see an 11% revenue decline this year; culprits include weak TV sales, strong European exposure, and ST-Ericsson's woes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Coverage of Chesapeake (CHK +2%) is resumed at Barclays with an Equal Weight rating and $20...

    Coverage of Chesapeake (CHK +2%) is resumed at Barclays with an Equal Weight rating and $20 target price, as the firm believes progress in executing planned asset sales should help address liquidity concerns. Jim Cramer adds his two cents, saying the CHK controversy has died down and shares will move up if natural gas does.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • QLIK

    Business intelligence software firm Qlik (QLIK +6.8%) pops on an upgrade to Overweight from...

    Business intelligence software firm Qlik (QLIK +6.8%) pops on an upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley. Shares have bounced off their July lows with the help of a positive earnings report (I, II), but remain well off their April highs due to concerns about European sales. Also up: INFA +1.7%. SPLK +3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBUX

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +1.6%) get a boost with positive comments out from Oppenheimer's Brian...

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +1.6%) get a boost with positive comments out from Oppenheimer's Brian Bittner. The analyst sees the Outperform-rated company raking it in from lower wholesale coffee prices to the tune of $0.09 to EPS in FY13 and $0.28 in FY14.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana (TEA +4.4%) move up today after its Q2 results beat on the top line amid a 38%...

    Shares of Teavana (TEA +4.4%) move up today after its Q2 results beat on the top line amid a 38% jump in Y/Y revenue. The company also guided FY12 sales higher, now expecting them to come in between $222M - $231M. Street estimates are for $220M. Goldman remains cautious on the shares however, saying same-store sales are still depressed, and profitability trends continue to be weak.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • BP

    The aggressive language in the Justice Department statement against BP (BP -2.7%) doesn't look...

    The aggressive language in the Justice Department statement against BP (BP -2.7%) doesn't look promising in reducing the chances of a swift settlement: “The behavior, words, and actions of these BP executives would not be tolerated in a middling size company manufacturing dry goods for sale in a suburban mall." BP may have a gross negligence case to answer, implying a potential $21B fine.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 8 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -10.3%) continues to bleed as its Lumia 920 unveiling fails to impress; shares are...

    Nokia (NOK -10.3%) continues to bleed as its Lumia 920 unveiling fails to impress; shares are now down 24% from their Aug. 27 highs. In addition to disappointment over the specs for the 920's PureView camera, the Street might not like the fact Nokia is only promising the phone will be available in "select markets" in Q4 (no date is provided). All signs point to the iPhone 5 going on sale on or around Sep. 21. Nokia also declined to make any promises about tablet releases. (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 20 Comments
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (MAKO -1.3%) drifts lower after being initiated with a Market Perform at Wells...

    Mako Surgical (MAKO -1.3%) drifts lower after being initiated with a Market Perform at Wells Fargo, but with lackluster commentary and a less than impressive $15 - $17 price target range. The firm says there's reason for optimism over the long term in the name, but over the near term the ramp up of its new hip application product is likely to be slower than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -7.3%) has plunged to new lows in the absence of major news. Shares have...

    A123 Systems (AONE -7.3%) has plunged to new lows in the absence of major news. Shares have triggered short-sale curbs, but given they now trade at a paltry $0.224, brokers are probably reluctant to lend shares regardless. 19.6% of A123's float was shorted as of Aug. 15. A123 was hurt last week by news GM is temporarily halting production of the Chevy Volt.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 6 Comments
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX +0.5%) reiterates its Q and full year 2012 guidance as part of its presentation...

    OfficeMax (OMX +0.5%) reiterates its Q and full year 2012 guidance as part of its presentation at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing Conference (webcast), noting that strategic initiatives are boosting results. Shares of OMX aren't catching the nice kick that ODP is seeing from reiterated guidance as ODP is tagged by some as the weaker name in the sector and more likely to disappoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +8.4%) surges after announcing initial test results of its Boy Scout 1-33H...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +8.4%) surges after announcing initial test results of its Boy Scout 1-33H well that targets the Utica Shale. The well tested at 3,456 boe/day, a strong follow-up to GPOR's initial Wagner well that tested at 4,650 boe/day. Boy Scout results indicate GPOR has found a sweet spot in the Utica that generates both high flow rates and high liquids cuts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +1.9%) turns around after opening sharply lower on Credit Suisse's...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +1.9%) turns around after opening sharply lower on Credit Suisse's downgrade of the stock and reduction in its target price to $30 from $50. The firm cited CLF's massive exposure to iron ore, which has seen prices fall 35% in the last two months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -8.1%) dives as it unveils the Lumia 920 at an NYC event. As expected, the Windows...

    Nokia (NOK -8.1%) dives as it unveils the Lumia 920 at an NYC event. As expected, the Windows Phone 8-based 920 has a 4.5" display, supports wireless charging, and (perhaps critically) contains a PureView camera less impressive than the one in the Symbian-based 808. Also included is an augmented reality app called City Lens. Will this be enough for Nokia to gain significant ground against the iPhone 5 and Samsung's high-end lineup? (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 48 Comments
  • ODP

    Office Depot (ODP +14.9%) soars after execs tip off at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing...

    Office Depot (ODP +14.9%) soars after execs tip off at the Goldman Sachs Global Retailing Conference that they will stick by the company's full-year 2012 outlook. Management also says pensioners are being offered a lump sum buyout so that the firm can simplify its balance sheet. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +9.1%) break higher after M&A rumors help spur a bit of a short...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +9.1%) break higher after M&A rumors help spur a bit of a short squeeze. Despite the lack of clarity on the buyout chatter, volume is sky-high on the heavily shorted name.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM

  • The euro/Swiss franc cross continues a big move higher, touching CHF 1.2046 as the SNB declines...

    The euro/Swiss franc cross continues a big move higher, touching CHF 1.2046 as the SNB declines to comment on speculation it is considering raising the CHF 1.20 floor. These occasional rumors are helpful to the SNB, perhaps allowing the bank to unload some of its vast stash of euros at prices higher than it bought them for.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3.4%) trades higher after Jefferies starts coverage at Buy as part of a broader...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3.4%) trades higher after Jefferies starts coverage at Buy as part of a broader launch for the Internet sector. The firm sees LinkedIn delivering a "beat and raise" Q3 report thanks to conservative guidance, and touts its ability to keep taking share in all 3 of its business segments (job postings, ad sales, and subscriptions) via differentiated solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields (GFI +1.5%) says the strike at the KDC East mine in South Africa has been resolved...

    Gold Fields (GFI +1.5%) says the strike at the KDC East mine in South Africa has been resolved and that striking employees have agreed to return to work tonight.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +11.1%) soar higher after the company catches an upgrade from Piper...

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +11.1%) soar higher after the company catches an upgrade from Piper Jaffray to Overweight. A note to clients from the firm says competitive concerns have been priced in, while new Green Dot's new deals are getting undervalued by the market.
